review.reviewBody: Bad design, not enough space to put the four holder on the bars. I have a St-Maurice canoë from Shawinigan, Canada.
review.name: Bad system
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback, Chaz. I am sorry to hear that your Thule Portage canoe carrier did not fit your vehicle and canoe as expected.
This carrier is designed to fit all Thule crossbar systems and most factory-installed vehicle crossbars. Depending on how far apart your crossbar mounts are, and the style of crossbar, that could restrict the canoe width that can fit between the mounting points. 
For more information on possible ways to troubleshoot this, please contact Thule Customer Support!
https://help.thule.com/s/contactsupport?language=en_US

review.reviewBody: I’v had to replace the Thule square bar system due to rust after 20 years of excellent performance. The square bar canoe carrier was solid, easy to adjust and much sleeker than its replacement.  However this unit is easier to install and remove and does the job well enough.
review.name: Solidbut bulky and difficult to adjust

review.reviewBody: I have the older version works much easier.  The price is ridiculous.
review.name: Older version

review.reviewBody: Easy to install so far so good. Can't wait to use it this summer
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Trying to research options to haul a canoe a few times on my F150 and this came up. It’s a bit of a pricey option when combined with the the roof rack. In the end I was able to haul a canoe securely without issue. All straps were provided and the install was easy and secure. I’d recommend it.
review.name: Gets the job done

review.reviewBody: Simple to use and holds the canoe tight.  I appreciate that it can be quickly moved from one vehicle to another and it is configurable for the various cross bars.  Very happy with my Thule Portage.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Bought at the same time I purchased the Wingbar Evo (which I'm very happy with). I followed the specifications for my car (Chevy Cruze). Bought this product for my canoe. We followed the instructions (which could be a lot clearer, and youtube videos, and unfortunately, it does not fit. The clamps that the canoe is supposed to rest on need to be place on the outside of the Evo Clamps. This is not how it was designed. Disappointed as I followed Thule's buying advice for my vehicle. Also the instructions for the ropes needs to be a lot clearer and we managed but I'm not convinced it was right. In the end, placing the canoe one the roof rack and tying down with the ratchet straps with rope at the front and back does the trick. You don't this product, it was a waste on money and we could have bought cheaper ratchet straps and rope.
review.name: Doesn't fit properly, you don't need this product

review.reviewBody: Had a set for 20 years on my Saab that worked flawlessly. These fit my canoe perfectly. and hold well.
review.name: Work Beautifully

review.reviewBody:
I drove about 4000 km across Canada with a canoe using this product connected to wingbar evo's on a Forester. I've done lots of canoe tripping before and used other systems, including tying directly to bars and foam supports. 

A few notes on install:
- Ensure that your cross bars are wide enough and that their attachment points won't impede with the installation of these friction-based attachments. Canoe gunnels at the attachment points are generally 2.5 to 3 feet wide, so you need bars of the same width or more for this attachment system to work, as it needs to wrap around the entire bar to clamp to. One of my side had these attachments on the outside of the clamps to the roof rack and the other two on the inside (i.e., the canoe was offset and not on the centre of the car, as the clamps were in the way).
- Figuring out 2 Nm of force is difficult with these screw clamps; what typical person knows that? Since friction was the only thing holding these things on, I screwed them as hard as my fingers would allow.
- The product comes with two tie-downs for the front and back of the vehicle. Four would be better (see below).

I fell in love with the product during the first 2500 km through Ontario. It worked flawlessly. It was easy to install and the canoe was very snug to the bars. I didn't feel comfortable driving over 105 km/h, as the car handling seemed to feel a bit uneasy above those speeds. But that was ample fast for the roads I was on.

Now, the reason for dropping one star. Once we got to the Prairies, the wind picked up to a 40 to 60 km/h crosswind. This meant that we could really only drive between 60 and 80 km/h comfortably, as the wind was dramatically pushing the canoe around. The crosswind was slowly sliding the attachments away from the gunnels, since they are only friction-based. We had to stop every hour or so to push the attachments snug against the gunnels, and I was tightening them as much as I could to try to limit this. The only thing I wonder is if we had four tie-downs rather than just the two, that may have limited lateral movement of the canoe. I will certainly be attempting that with future uses of this product.

Overall, it is a great product and I recommend it, particularly if you are not exclusively driving in commonly windy areas.
review.name: Great product; caution with strong wind

review.reviewBody: I have used other car roof canoe carriers and found them lacking.  This one, used in combination with the Evo WingBar, is tremendously better.  The engineering and quality of materials is impressive.  I can't imagine anything more secure and easy to use.
review.name: Superior Product

name: Portage Canoe Carrier

description: Buy the Thule Landmark 40L Travel Pack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Landmark 40L Travel Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Landmark 40L Travel Pack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Perfect in every way as expected from such a great brand
review.name: Amazing Bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag and unfortunately had to return it as the shoulder straps are so close together I felt like I was being choked by them! I'm a 5'3" woman so I can't imagine how tight it would be on a larger body/broader shoulders. Disappointed as this bag was very promising.
review.name: Great features but poor functionality

review.reviewBody: just what I was looking for. very well made. keep up the good work Thule!
review.name: Excellent bag

review.reviewBody:
I just got back from 9 days in Thailand and needed a bag that would hold everything PLUS be carry on approved. This bag held everything down tight and I had my laptop inside the computer compartment. Loved all the extras you don't notice until you get the bag. Security features are awesome and I wonder who thought of them because they rock. This bag is has super clean lines when everything is cinched down and made it super easy putting in overhead plane bins, bus bins, on ferry's and carrying on my back when riding a moped. The ability to hide the waist straps is really good. When traveling I saw so many other travelers with waist straps that just hang free. Why is this an issue? When stopping at bathrooms, for example, they put their bags on the floor and the straps are resting on really gross bathroom floors; in Thailand some of the toilets are just holes in the floor and a bucket of water to "flush." My bag straps where neatly tucked away. The top hard case is such an amazing feature and the hidden water bottle compartment. My girlfriend had a similar Northface bag and she keeps bugging me to buy her one of these. Only thing I would change is something I read in another persons review; I'd change the orientation of the top hard safety compartment's zipper. When the bag is laying flat, say on a bed, and the straps for the bag are on the bottom side, if one opens the hard case anything loose will fall out. It's not a big issue at all though. I also bought travel cubes and that made a huge difference. Twice I was stopped by TSA and they searched my bag; travel cubes made it SO easy to put everything back and get on my way! 

Long story short, do not hesitate to purchase this bag! I never leave reviews but felt this bag deserved it.
review.name: Pretty much perfect backpack!

review.reviewBody: It's a decent size. The thing I found really annoying while traveling and wearing the backpack was getting something out of the bag while wearing it. There is no top zipper, so getting things out of the bag was awkward.
review.name: It's...a bag. Not totally worth the money.

review.reviewBody: I took this with me backpacking through Switzerland and Greece! It was absolutely perfect. I love how the zipper opens the middle compartment similar to a suitcase. This feature makes it so much easier to get your belongings out. It prevents digging through everything to find what you are looking for. I picked the 40L since we were only backpacking a week at a time. The size was perfect for me. I am 5'3 and even filled to the max this backpack was not too heavy or big for me. I was able to use this as a carry on with no issue on 4 flights (each a different airline). Oh and the green is awesome! I highly recommend this product!!
review.name: THIS BACKPACK IS A MUST!

review.reviewBody: I thought I had found the perfect bag, but alas it is slightly too big on the one dimension for the airline I am flying to Europe on.  The British Airways web site says 22in X 14in X 9in, and this bag is 9.8 X 13 X 21.5 in.  Such a disappointment as this looks like a fantastic bag, but I'm not going to spend this kind of money for something I have to check because someone at the airport is being a jerk.
review.name: OMG just slightly too big for British Airways!

name: Landmark 40L Travel Pack

review.reviewBody: Picked this up as I wanted a dedicated DH/Enduro helmet and to move away from the Bell Super DH I had been using for so many years.  I have a speedframe half shell which I used to gauge my sizing and that was a bit of a mistake.  These helmets are cut large.  I use a medium in the speedframe but on this am almost using every click the BOA system has to get a tight fit.  So measure your head and double check before ordering.  Speaking of the BOA system - its amazing.  Instead of just tightening from the back of the head the boa pulls from back and front so you keep you head centered in the helment and its easy to find a comfortable setting.  The large air vents provide a ton of air so I feel like it will do a great job of keeping me cooler in the hot humid north east summers.
review.name: Great air flow and comfortable fit

name: Proframe RS Helmet

review.reviewBody:
If you’re on the hunt for a daypack that combines sustainability, durability, and comfort, look no further than the Nemo Resolve™ Men’s 25L Endless Promise® Technical Active Daypack. This pack is not just a bag; it’s a commitment to endless adventures and environmental responsibility.

Design and Comfort: The first thing you’ll notice about the Resolve™ Daypack is its sleek, modern design. Available in eye-catching colors like Smokey Olive and Citron, this pack is as stylish as it is functional. The wide, flexible shoulder straps mold to your body, providing immediate and long-lasting comfort. Whether you’re hiking up a mountain or navigating city streets, the spring steel internal frame supports heavier loads without compromising on comfort.

Innovative Materials: What sets the Resolve™ Daypack apart is its use of Nemo-exclusive fabrics. The CERO™ fabric is not only abrasion-resistant and water-resistant but also made entirely from recycled PET, making it a champion of sustainability. The CCubed™ cushioning, positioned at the body’s heaviest sweat zones, wicks away sweat and helps it evaporate, keeping you cool and dry even on the hottest days.
Functionality: This pack is designed with the active adventurer in mind. It features a large panel-load compartment that easily fits larger items like a hydration bladder or extra layers. The hidden security pocket keeps your valuables safe, while the adjustable side pockets can house even the beefiest water bottles or an extra layer. The removable compression straps can be configured to the side or bottom of the pack, allowing you to secure your load or lash on additional items as needed.

Sustainability: One of the most impressive aspects of the Resolve™ Daypack is its commitment to sustainability. Part of Nemo’s Endless Promise® collection, this pack is designed to stay out of the landfill forever. When it finally reaches the end of its life, it can be sent back to Nemo for total recycling, ensuring it lives on as new gear for the next adventurer.

Final Thoughts: The Nemo Resolve™ Men’s 25L Endless Promise® Technical Active Daypack is a game-changer for anyone who loves the great outdoors. Its combination of innovative materials, thoughtful design, and commitment to sustainability makes it a must-have for any adventure. Whether you’re a seasoned hiker or a weekend warrior, this pack will be your trusty companion on countless journeys.

So, gear up and get ready to explore with the Nemo Resolve™ Daypack – because every adventure deserves a pack that’s up for the challenge!
review.name: The Ultimate Adventure Companion: Nemo Resolve™

review.reviewBody: I finally was able to try out this pack on a couple hikes in the WA cascades this past weekend and really loved it! The shoulder straps are very comfortable and I really like that the torso length can be adjusted which isn't super common on packs this size. The 25L fits quite a lot and is an excellent choice for a full day out on the trail. The included tension straps work well to cinch it down if you're not carrying as much. I have only used it in dry conditions so far, but I am excited to try it out in wetter weather and in the winter so see how well the outer shell repels water. If I had to change one thing specifically for the 25L, I would add padding to the hip belt and extend the portion with padding out a bit so there is more support when carrying more. Other than that I think it's a great pack and am happy with my purchase!
review.name: Nice and versatile day pack!

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this pack for a bit now and to say I’m impressed, is an understatement. This pack seem very well thought out! Everything from the materials, to the pocket size/placement, to the location of loops, to the zippers and buckles. Everything just… works. That’s all I want in a pack, one that works. This pack works really well, and I’m never left disappointed after using it! I highly recommend!
review.name: New favorite backpack

review.reviewBody: I have had the Men's Resolve 25L for almost 2 weeks now. I love the pack. Perfect for my needs. Will be using it during my half dome hike in a couple of weeks. The quality seems solid. I definitely recommend this pack!
review.name: Great pack for hiking!

review.reviewBody: Recently bought the 25L for day hikes with kids and it’s been holding up amazing! It rides extremely comfortable and carries plenty without being too large!
review.name: Amazing Bag!

review.reviewBody: I just received my Resolve 35. I like the pack very much. It is a great size, not so huge that it is overwhelming or uncomfortable, but it is really big inside to fit a lot of gear. I have found two things about it that I don’t like. On the brain on top of the bag there is a zipper that is kind of hidden and hard to access. The other small flaw is that the sternum strap does not slide up and down on the straps. Instead there are slots that you use to attach the strap. This limits the location and you might not find the exact spot you want. Small flaw, definitely not super important. Other than those two small negatives, I really like the look, and the function of this pack.
review.name: Like it

review.reviewBody: It’s so nice how this bag can be well secured to your body, the contour and the straps are very comfortable.
review.name: Love the waist holsters

review.reviewBody: The materials are high quality, the layout of the pack is very useful. I love the included bungee straps on the inside that can be moved to the outside to add more use, while still having a clean design.
review.name: Great Features

review.reviewBody: Comfort is the name of the game for this backpack! The wide, flexible shoulder straps are super comfortable, especially with the squishy CCubed. The internal spring steel frame is not common on a bag of this size. I really appreciate how it adds to the support. The backpack has so many features and plenty of storage options. Not to mention Nemo's stance on sustainability and recyclability. It takes a lot of effort to design and manufacture products the way they do. Hats off to them.
review.name: Super comfortable, great features

review.reviewBody: I got this in about a month ago, and so far I really like it. 25L is perfect for a blitz day hike or a longer multipitch climb IMHO. And the bag is set up very well. Large center, top zipper, small zippered pouch up top, holds hydration and has comfy shoulder straps. I only gave it 4 starts because I think the zippers could be beefier, and sometimes they snag on the flaps protecting the zipper line.
review.name: Buy it

name: Resolve 25L Endless Promise Backpack

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am actually insulted with how bad this fit/felt. for the price I paid I will forever think differently of mountain hardware. The sleeves were WAY too large and way too long while the torso was skintight. You know, not everyone who buys a XXL is 6'5 132lbs. JUST SAYIN. Returning tomorrow morning.

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good undercoat for wet weather! This is like Patingoina.
review.name: PolarTec is my favorite, breathable and without a replacement for me!

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: The zip hoody is my first, but fits well, looks great and works great as a base layer or with a tshirt on a cool day. Mountain Hardwear makes a quality products and this is one more. FYI, it's a lot brighter of a blue than the images. But, that's okay.
review.name: Great Layer for Multiple Uses

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent ultralight hoodie! Warmth to weight ratio is excellent! Long raglan style sleeves are awesome!
review.name: Money well spent!

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: Amazing !! Love this thing for all things outside or mountain.
review.name: Great piece.

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm very happy with this layer! I'm sold on the grid technology and will be worn or in my pack on every shoulder season trip in the future. Perfect fit.
review.name: Perfect layering component!

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: Stretchy and warm, a great fitting jacket. I wear it daily. I'm 6'2", 220lbs with a muscular build and I wear an XL.
review.name: Daily wear comfort that looks good.

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Man, this thing is awesome. Perfect temperature range for what I was hoping for and a lot more comfortable than I was expecting. Recently had it on for the first leg of a 14 mile day hike and it reduced the amount of layer changing on the hike to zero. 

Little tight on the forearms, but not noticable if you're just wearing a base under it. Would wear it non stop if I wasn't a slob.
review.name: Love this thing.

Very happy with the shirt so far. Nice design and the price was on sale so its was even nicer :-)
Its on the bigger side of sizes, a roomy Medium sort of.
review.name: Comfy, warm and stylish

review.reviewBody:
Nice material and I like the zippered pocket.  The Large fit well in everything but length.  at least 2 inches to short.   I couldnt reach over my head without exposing middrift.  The XL was long enough but meant for someone with a 40inch plus waist.  At 6'0" tall, 170lb, and a 33in waist I am neither exceptionally tall or skinny.  Why does everyone in the ski industry only make clothing for short obese people?  Please someone break the norm and offer tall sizing in 
 casual wear and thermal tops!
review.name: Not for anyone over 5'10 who isnt obese

review.itemreviewed: Xperior Primaloft Loose Fill Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
An exceptional lightweight jacket with a sleek and aesthetic design. Last year, Adidas released the Verilite, but I find this year's design even more attractive. The jacket features insulation while still maintaining breathability. Perfect for both outdoor activities and casual wear. It offers a streamlined fit and still is comfortable.
I haven’t had the chance to fully test the water repellent properties. 
However, there are a few areas for improvement. First, the cuffs could be adjustable, I dislike the 
 elastic ones that comes with. The hood could also be larger for better coverage; although I haven’t tested it in rain, it doesn’t seem to provide great protection. 

I was surprised that Adidas didn’t include folding instructions in the inner pocket. The process isn’t very intuitive, which could be a simple fix, even a video on the jacket’s page.

I would also love to see Adidas specify the warmth range for all their jackets. This would help customers better determine which jacket is best suited for their needs, especially when shopping for colder climates.

On the plus side, the jacket allows for a full range of motion. It fits true to size, and there's still enough room to comfortably layer a hoodie underneath.
review.name: Lightweight with room for improvement.

review.reviewBody: Super cute coat but it is abit short so I give it a 2
review.name: Cute

review.reviewBody: Are great warm weather or Spring / Fall pants, with a great comfortable fit.  I got Verde green and love the dark green.  They ran out and only have black. Got Large, 5’7”, 160 lbs. 5 stars !
review.name: Love these and will find another pair

review.reviewBody: Nice stretchy material. Felt durable and heavy but almost scratchy. The pockets fit my phone perfectly, but the proportions/lower waist didn't quite work for my body (I have a long torso).
review.name: Waist too low for long torso

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing this pants for a month now and find them super comfortable, lightweight, and great for active fit wear. Thinking to get a second pair!
review.name: Super comfy

review.reviewBody: I just got these pants and the Ferrosi transit. Both have turned into my favourite travel/exploring pants and I can't wait to wear them in the field this summer/fall.
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: Fit perfectly. I’m 5’7 and the length is good. Very comfy and a nice mid-high rise waist. Did come with a tiny snag on the leg but it probably would’ve happened with wear anyway.
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: I love these pants. I'd been searching for something that would fit well and these certainly do. Quite comfy, too!
review.name: Love 'em.

review.reviewBody: Hey all-- if you are a hiking mama these are for you! Love the way they fit post-baby (aka the elastic waist is fabulous for parts of you that may have changed). I wear these for everything from backcountry hiking to teaching in front of a classroom. The BEST hiking pants I have ever owned. After wearing them for pretty much everything they are showing a bit of wear (piling, etc.) but I really have put them through the ringer. 100% recommend. I have them in 5 colors and they are pretty much what I live in! BONUS- they have great pockets.
review.name: Best Fit for A New Body

review.reviewBody: I got these pants for my girlfriend for Christmas. She likes how they look, fit and feel a lot, but said she would give them 4 stars. This was due to the substantial piling they incurred after her first time wearing them to the climbing gym, and they do mention using these for climbing in the product description.
review.name: Cute, comfy and function, but durability issues

review.reviewBody: I've had several pairs of Zendos. I wear them often, wear them hard, wear them out, switch to a new pair and repeat. These are the perfect multi-purpose outdoor pants. The slightly loose but still structured fit works for a wide range of temperatures and activities allowing for tights underneath if it's cold or not (the old style had the option to convert to capris, which I miss, but I guess things do change). I'll take these over Ferrosi pants any day - those aren't bad, but Zendos are perfect.
review.name: The ultimate outdoor pants

review.reviewBody: I'm just so happy to have discovered these. They fit. They are comfortable. They are long enough. I will be purchasing more, for sure. I just wish they had more colors (gray would be fab!). Thank you, OR!
review.name: Finally Found Pants I Love!

name: Zendo Pant - Women's

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought this for my wife for the French alps. Despite the -6C / 20F it was fantastic with a merino base layer. The jacket is comfortable, warm, and not heavy or bulky.
review.name: Great warmth and value!

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket in high school and still wear it over 10 years later. There's no doubt in my mind will I buy this jacket again for more years to come. Only recently has the waterproofing given way, and the top layer started to show holes. This jacket has kept me completely dry in pouring rain and warm when everyone else was freezing. From winter hiking, through many deployments, and all around everyday this is the one thing I always being with me. I recommend it hands down and will never buy anything else.
review.name: I bought this jacket over 10 years ago

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: The jacket appears to be good quality, but BEWARE of the colors displayed on Backcountry's website.  I ordered the Cornflower color.  For this color, the Backcountry website clearly displays images of a Cornflower (light blue) removable inner puffy jacket, matching the color of the outer shell part of the jacket.  However, the actual product shipped by Backcountry has a jet-black inner puffy jacket.
review.name: Colors differ from website
comment: We appreciate you bringing this to our attention and have sent you an email to follow up.

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for my daughter. She loves it. It's comfortable and stylish and keeps her really warm. I would definitely buy it again.
review.name: Great jacket!!

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have had many North Face jackets and this one is by far the best. I like all of the pockets and the high collar that has plenty of room to zip up over my face. I would definitely buy this again!
review.name: Great 3 in 1 coat

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: So far I am loving this dual jacket! It replaced an older Tri-Vent dual jacket combo....the waterproofing was no longer effective. (And it is now called, Dri-Vent) I haven't been out in a major downpour, but thus far, it has been great on the rainy days experienced. I am not sure about how warm it will feel with second jacket/liner in it. Haven't experienced that really, hence, the 4 out of 5 rating. Also, although I do think the cornflower color is pretty, my last jacket was a darker blue. I know there was a purple combo option and black. For a person who loves SOME color, the purple didn't feel that attractive and the cornflower blue color will likely show the dirt much easier-around cuffs/seat. We travel and I suspect attaching it to backpacks, etc. will show that.
review.name: Doesn't disappoint thus far!

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Used for skiing Large chest pocket fits my humungous phone Runs very small, I take a small to medium and the medium is tight
review.name: Runs small

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So many great features! Goggle wipe, inner pocket, inner pouch, chest pocket, snow skirt, etc!
review.name: Love it

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for Hokkaido trip in the winter. It kept me warm and able to enjoy the snow while being comfortable. I love it!
review.name: I would buy this product again and again.

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use this for snowboarding. I love it because when it's warmer out I can just use the shell, super easy to put both together again.
review.name: Love it

name: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Vioz Lux GTX RR Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Worth the money. I am most impressed with the security of the treads and how comfortable the soul are when hiking.
review.name: Worth it

review.itemreviewed: Vioz Lux GTX RR Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Second pair after 3.5 years...These boots are the best.  As an ISA Certified Arborist, exceptional footwear is a critical part of daily equipment.  Zamberlan have held up to the stresses of working in trees, backpacking in the Appalachian MT (NC, TN, WV, VA), UVM work in multiple states, & California PI work from canyon floor to mountain peak.  I upgraded from my last pair and plan on upgrading again to have a back-up pair.  All my local outdoor stores were out of the size and style I needed.  Backcountry is dependable.  After ordering, I had the boots within three days, and by day four was sporting new kicks up the side of the mountain.  I highly recommend these boots or any line of  Zamberlan boots.  I also highly recommend purchasing from Backcountry.
review.name: RBC Tree

review.itemreviewed: Vioz Lux GTX RR Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The boots fit me right out of the box.  Needs a limited amount of breaking in.  Very comfortable right from the start.  Great quality workmanship.  Too early to discuss longevity, but I suspect that I'll have these boots for years.  Definitely recommend.
review.name: Vioz Lux GTX RR Backpacking Boot

review.itemreviewed: Vioz Lux GTX RR Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Ok, here's my story and I'm sticking to it. I do not have more than a couple of dozen moderately strenuous 6 mile hikes under my belt yet, but have decided to change that to a weekly hike - gradually increasing length and difficulty as things/life allows.

 Before this purchase I had a very good bang for the old buck hiker, but noticed on the last hike I was starting to really feel those rocks underfoot more than I had been, so I decided to search for another boot. Now, a bit more background - I'm 66 years old, with some age related physical issues - sciatica, bad knees and flat arches. Given that picture I was looking for a boot that would provide excellent support - especially laterally, over those very rocky trails, good traction, good construction, comfortable and even though I would not be carrying heavy packs, this took me into the hiking/backpacking boot area rather than the lighter hiker offerings. I could deal with the extra weight and perhaps a longer break-in time over the lighter hiking boots if it would offer me that extra support I need in a boot. 
 
 In these Covid times, having the opportunity of going into a store and checking out a half dozen or more boots was not an option. So I went about reading online reviews and checking the specs on a bunch of the heavier boots. Bottom line is that out of the box these were simply extremely comfortable and of a very noticeable high  quality - but then again at almost twice the price of most boots that;s to be expected. The fact that these are boots are made in Italy was not lost on me either.

Opening the box, I immediately knew these were a very high quality and beautiful pair of boots - all stitching and seams were perfect. Being an older guy, I'm partial to the retro stye, leather boots, rather than the more modern, multicolored offerings - but only if they work. These sure do!  Putting them on for the first time, they seemed a little tight (I'm a size 10.5) but after lacing them up and walking around the house and up and down the stairs and within minutes these began fitting like the proverbial glove.
With that confidence inspiring quick fitting, I took them on 2 hikes this week with my family - both about 6 miles over very rocky, hilly, sometimes muddy trails. These boots offered excellent lateral support, especially over rocks as well isolating/protecting from the feel/pain of hiking over some of those not so flat rocks. The soles provided very good traction and support on ascending and descending the trails. The soles - with that "rocker" motion really does, for lack of a better word, does "propel" you forward. The lacing hardware looks to be extremely well made and durable. The calf leather lined collars provide nice comfort above the ankles. When the boots got muddy, I simply stood in a stream and had the moving water clean 'em up. Although I did not spend minutes in the stream, I was pleased no water got inside the boots. The leather is coated/waterproofed from the factory, but of course will require additional waterproofing as they get worn - same as any boots. 

 I hated to scuff these all leather beauties up but did so within the first mile or so on the trail. The toe rand on any hiking boots IMHO, is an absolute necessity in preventing undo and inevitable damage to the toe area. If I had one "suggestion/improvement" to make for this boot, it would be to have a full rand around the entire boot - but that's also because I'm rough on my shoes/boots when wearing them, but I also know taking proper care and cleaning of shoes/boots goes is essential for comfort and longevity. 
I realize that most people don't need the extra protection of a backpacking boot, but for those that do - myself included, I'm extremely happy with my choice and would recommend them in a heartbeat for anyone looking for a classic boot, made with real deal one-piece leather that's built to last. Liked these so much, I just placed an order of the women?s version for my wife and daughter.
review.name: Very Impressed

name: Vioz Lux GTX RR Backpacking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: This coat is cozy and functional! It is a tad difficult to get off as a pullover though. The pockets are great and there is a good amount of insulation.
review.name: Great winter jacket!

review.reviewBody: Love the way this looks and feels. I wish they had more colors because the darker rusty copper/orange is not really my thing, and the yellow is very intense. However, this makes you very easy to find in the snow which my friends appreciate. Easy to take on and off, and feels very well made. I'm 5'6 and 130-140lbs, the small fit fine, but I think I medium would also fit! I have a bigger booty, so the small was just a tad too fitted around the butt area for me personally, but I was looking for a baggy look.
review.name: Super cute and comfy!

review.reviewBody: Its super warm and looks great!
review.name: My favorite jacket

review.reviewBody: it feels and fits nice. I love the full side zip for easy getting it on and off.
review.name: Love this jacket...

review.reviewBody: While checking tickets, a lift operator complimented my new OR anorak and bib ensemble! She mentioned how she liked the color combination and how it coordinated with my complexion. It made my day that much better.
review.name: Compliments!

review.reviewBody: I absloutely loved everything about this coat but the sizing guide seems way off. I followed the recommended sizing guide and it suggested I would be XL after I measured myself. I thought that size seemed too big so I ordered a large instead. When I received the large in the mail and tried it on, it was way too big on me. I like my ski/snowboard coats big but I think I could've went with a size medium or small. The sizing guide for this coat is way off. I usually am a large to XL with Burton but I would recommend going even smaller with Outdoor Research.
review.name: Way too big

review.reviewBody: Wore this for 3 days of skiing. It is comfortable, warm, and flattering on. The deep front packet was perfect for keeping the essentials (phone, wallet, etc.) and easy to access even on the lift. My only complaint is that it's a little tricky to get on and take off with just the side zipper access. However, most ski gear is clunky in some way and I feel that effort is outweighed by the other benefits of the coat.
review.name: Comfortable, warm, flattering.

review.reviewBody: I love my new ski jacket!
review.name: I love it!

review.reviewBody: First off I love anything OR!! I was stoked to pick up a new FUN snowboard kit for the season, especially being in a larger body. It's easy for my friends to find me on the slopes since it stands out and it gets tons of compliments. The two front pockets are great options for phone and snacks and easy to get stuff out on the lift even if it's crowded. It's weatherproof, the right amount of warmth for Washington and Alaska resort riding (where just a good base layer underneath is perfect) with lots of vent options. The only and very limited cons: No lift pass pocket on the arm so I either need to buy an arm band for it or continue getting it out of my pocket and risk dropping it each time. I prefer to use the chest pocket for credit card/ID, so I don't like keeping my lift pass there plus it's awkward to tap rfid scanners. The side zipper goes from waist to armpit to allow for lots of venting, but it needs to be rezipped after falls or a couple runs because the bottom zipper works its way up. Still definitely recommend to anyone as long as you're ok with a work around for your lift pass! Just hoping next iteration can at least include a lift pass pocket :)
review.name: OR does it again!!

review.reviewBody: I am a plus size skier and this coat was amazing. It fit over my hips. It was stylish and warm. The pocket help my ski pass and I had not issue accessing the lift. I received many comments on this coat. I am hooked on this brand! Ya'll know how to make a plus size active girl feel great!
review.name: I would buy this AGAIN... give me all the gear!

review.reviewBody: Backcountry sent me a repackaged (used?) item with another person's address label on it. The box is all damaged and re-taped. I have not opened it yet and I am not sure if I should just ship it back. Really disappointing!
review.name: Received old repackaged item

review.reviewBody: Bought these to go with my Thule Evo Aeroblade cross bars and they fit seamlessly and installation was a breeze! Love the look and feel of them, very happy with the purchase.
review.name: Easy Installation, Looks Great!

review.reviewBody: Bought for my son to enjoy his season ski pass.  Easy to assemble and fit out car just as the search helped us choose compatible racks!
review.name: Great Product!!

review.reviewBody: Bought the Snowpack large to replace our Snowpack medium which was stolen along with our car earlier this year...long story. This rack works flawlessly. The T-Bar mounting is super easy and VERY clean looking. The release mechanism is large and works in sub zero temps. Skis are held securely and are easy to load provided you're tall enough to reach more than just the edge of your car roof.
review.name: Second time around this time with the larger model

review.reviewBody: Easy to use and well designed for easy use and installation.
review.name: Easy install and well designed

review.reviewBody: The SnowPack is an adaptable ski rack with multiple mounting options that was easy to fit to my different vehicles. It’s simple and fast to load and unload skis and snowboards.
review.name: An adaptable product that I recommend

review.reviewBody:
I have Rhino Rack Reconn bars on my Jeep Wrangler.  I was able to install these Thule ski holders with no extra parts needed.  The Tule T-bolts work perfectly in the Reconn bars.
After looking at Yakima, I learned that Yakima need over $100 of extra parts to make them work.  These Thule bars are also easy to install and remove with NO tools!  Which is great, because they will come off for summer time.  Very pleased with these.  They also come with two lengths of bolts and height risers, which should be used if there are clearance issues when snowbards are upside down.
review.name: Works with Rhino Rack Reconn bars

review.reviewBody: This replaced one that was over 20 years, it’s sad because my rack was still in great condition but it wound only fit square bars and they don’t make adapters for aero bars so I had to spend a couple hundred. Other than that the rack is basically the same.
review.name: Ski rack

review.reviewBody: Rack feels solid mounted to factory crossbars on Subaru.  However, I’m a really handy guy and found the install instructions to be probably the worst I’ve ever seen.   Considering the application for this product is keeping thousands of dollars of skis fixed to a roof instead of an airborne projectile as you hurtle down the highway at 75mph, Thule should be able to write a decent manual.
review.name: Good rack.    Atrocious installation instructions.

review.reviewBody: This is my first snowboard rack and I couldn’t be happier!  I didn’t know what I needed so I called and customer service was really helpful. It was really easy to install and if we can just get some good snow - I can hit the slopes!!
review.name: I love it!

name: SnowPack L Roof Mount

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It is flattering and kept me warm. I wore it on a trip to Iceland with a wool base layer underneath it. It was worn 4 times total (haven’t washed it yet). It has already started to pill as mentioned in the other reviews, so due to the quality, I took off two stars. Would be perfect if it didn’t pill.
review.name: Pills very easily.
comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our product. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing some issues with our product. In order to get a repair assessment, advice, or reimbursement, please fill out a Warranty Claim on our website under:

https://www.marmot.com/warranty-repair.html

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wore this new jacket recently for a morning walk.  Super flattering fit, not bulky look, very packable.  As the temps warmed I was able to take advantage of the 1/2 zip to cool off, I ended up taking it off and was able to carry it easily by tying arms around my waist.
review.name: Warm and very light weight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits great and very comfortable is what my wife says.  She enjoys wearing it when she walks everyday and keeps her warm.
review.name: Sharp and cozy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loved this jacket, but had to return it as the color turned my olive skin a ghastly yellow color. It is more of a blue purple than a red purple (which was what I was hoping for).  I have two of the WarmCube Active Alt full zip models and love them for their light weight and warmth.  Also really love the two outer chest pockets with zippers, great for lip balm, a spare key, and other small objects.
review.name: WarmCube Rocks!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am in love with this outwear.  The color of it is amazing. It is very comfortable.  It keeps you extremely warm.  It is very soft. I love the look of the 3/4 zipper.  I highly recommend it to stay warm while being outside.
review.name: I love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This has got to be my most favorite pullover of all time. First, the color is so unique and beautiful. But the warmth of this thin pullover is unbelievable. It doesn’t get really cold in our area until January, but there was a chilly and windy day this month where I had a chance to really test it out. I was surprised at how warm it kept me in the morning hours and by late morning I had to take it off because it was making me too warm! I have no doubt this will be my go to this winter.
review.name: Love Love Love

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Oh my goodness this jacket is super soft and very comfortable!! I am about a size 14/16 and ordered size large. The xlarge would probably fit better but this is still comfortable.  I love all of the pockets as well, just wish I could figure out how to roll/fold it up like the images show. 
This keep me very warm too, I love it for camping!
review.name: Soft & comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this slip on so much- I use it constantly for hiking and staying warm at outdoor sports events. The material is incredibly soft and light. Considering how lightweight and thin it is, I have no idea how it’s so warm. The pullover fits true to size and is very comfortable. It looks really great and is the perfect amount of form fitting. It’s very flattering for being “puffy”. I love the green color I have, but I’m going to get a couple other colors as well!
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am loving this lightweight jacket. The inner heat core keeps your body heat in and keeps you warm. It's lightweight and easy to pack as it smushes down into a small size. I find that it fits true to size and the sleeves are long enough which is usually hard to find. The quality appears to be excellent.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've used this for about a month now that the weather has turned very cold in NH. It's so cozy, but still breathable. The little pockets of stuffing don't feel bulky at all but do a great job keeping me warm. It's a different styling that I really like with both the pullover aspect and the little pockets of insulation. I get compliments everywhere o wear it.
review.name: So cozy

name: WarmCube Active Alt HB 1/2-Zip - Women's

review.reviewBody: packs up so small, kids can carry their own gear. Most kids gear is so expensive and bulky. I have a petite child so its even harder to find more technical and practical gear in her size. great buy. looks like it will last through more than a few hand me downs. best, got it on sale.
review.name: packs up

review.reviewBody: “Best jacket ever” was how my 9 year old described this piece of clothing. The fit is a little oversized but I personally love that she will be able to wear this for a few seasons before growing out of it, and she’s warm enough with a short sleeve shirt underneath on a 40 degree morning. Not to mention the color is beautiful. I will definitely be ordering a few more seasonal staples to add to her wardrobe!
review.name: “Best jacket ever”

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my 7 year old daughter to wear hiking the mighty 5 in Utah. Temps ranged from 20’s early in the morning to 60’s in the afternoon. This jacket was perfect to help keep her warm throughout the temps! She loves the colors and it fit comfortably!
review.name: Perfect spring hiking jacket for my daughter

review.reviewBody: This is a daily jacket for both of my kids. Perfect weight and layers well depending on temps. Not bulky, but warm. Great for active kids!
review.name: Love this jacket!!

review.reviewBody: I have two of these for myself so when I saw them for kids it was an easy decision. The same exact quality as the adult version but mini. Love all the pockets and reversible feature. My son loves to match with me. Runs a bit but perhaps true to size if you layer. Will definitely use year round- winter either under a heavier jacket or over a fleece, rain (will repel a light rain but not torrential), or a light jacket for fall/spring.
review.name: Family Favorite

review.reviewBody: The jacket fits perfectly and the colors are great. I would have appreciated if the description included what temperature the jacket could be best used. I am hoping it is warm enough for winter.
review.name: The jacket fits perfectly and

review.reviewBody: Love the colors and fit , my grandson loves his new jacket.
review.name: Love the colors and fit

review.reviewBody: We really love all of the Cotopaxi gear but when we found out they started making kids items, we had to try them. High quality products that fit great. My kids will be able to wear this for years!
review.name: We Love Cotopaxi

review.reviewBody: Great Cotopaxi quality for kids. The jacket is just as good as much adult version. My kid loves it.
review.name: Good Jacket

review.reviewBody:
The concept is good, but these did not work well with my 3T Ergonova Team drop bars. Wolf Tooth maintains a list of "known incompatible bars" on their site, and the Ergonovas are not on that list at time of writing.

I recently got a new gravel bike, and I purchased these tools to carry with me, since they check all the boxes I want for use on a bike with tubeless tires, thru axles, and disc brakes. On my second ride with these, I tried to pull out the bit driver to tweak my seat position and the plug end ripped off the sleeve. I threw the plug in my pocket and rode home with dead weight in my bar, hoping that I wouldn't need to get at the tubeless kit or chain tool in my other bar end. At home I had to use pliers to remove the stuck tool and sleeve. Later, I tried fitting the tool with the remaining sleeve, and the exact same thing happened. 

I would not recommend buying this product for use with drop bars. If you are adamant on using these with drop bars, see if you can find them in a local shop and confirm they fit in your bars before you buy. They are not packaged in such a way that you can return them after test fitting them if you buy them from Backcountry.
review.name: Not for drop bars

review.reviewBody:
Excited to get this tool!  Works super well as far as storage in handle bars.  Quiet no rattling as promised.  I do need to use my tire lever to get them out.   I have used the multi tool and the tire plug these work well.    Had not used the chain tool until today when my wife?s chain snapped 8 miles into the mountains.   Wasn?t worried , had the chain tool.  Put the chain tool on aligned it to the proper link pin and as soon as I added pressure the tool bent.   It is soft metal and not hardened.   We were left stranded by the wolf tooth chain tool on its first ever use.   Extremely extremely disappointed!   Like the concept but the metal quality sucks.  Makes me worry about the other tools as it looks like they are made of the same metal!  

I?m not sure I would purchase this again!
review.name: Good Concept ..Poor quality stranded me!

name: EnCase System Bar Kit One

review.reviewBody: Just got back from a beautiful fall ride with the new PNW Loam dropper post! Flawless operation and paired with the Loam lever for a great look..
review.name: Buttery smooth operation

review.reviewBody: I am very happy with this dropper post. I bought the Loam to replace the stock dropper on my Specialized Stumpjumper, and then enjoyed the Loam over 7 days on a 240 mile long MTB tour. Great value and price for this 34.9 x 170mm Travel post.
review.name: Excellent dropper post

review.reviewBody: Have 6 bikes in my fleet with droppers: 3 with Fox Transfer and 3 with PNW Loam and I must say the Loams are the most predictable, consistent and smooth droppers of the bunch. I have had two for a year or more and one for a few months. Would buy again in a heartbeat.
review.name: PNW Loam is awesome!!

review.reviewBody: The seat post has very quick response from the compressed down position which is exactly what I needed when going through rock gardens or rocky terrain on the trails. Excellent purchase!
review.name: Loam Dropper Seat Post

review.reviewBody: First things first, don’t forget to buy The dropper lever/trigger. The dropper is amazing. The ratings are accurate and for the price it is one of the best I’ve ever had. I was on the RockShox Reverb dropper, and this is a huge improvement.
review.name: The perfect dropper

review.reviewBody: Awesome dropper with great adjustability. Light too at 462g on my scale in 30.9mm size with 125mm of travel. Hopefully will never need it, but the lifetime warranty is exceptional. On the trail it works perfectly with a snappy return.
review.name: Awesome dropper

review.reviewBody: Works well but only used a few times. Let's hope it stays that way. Tried others well known brands but was disappointed.
review.name: Works well so far

review.reviewBody: The PNW loam dropper is fantastic. The price point is much lower compared to competitors, like Fox. Installation was very simple. I also really enjoyed the tool free micro adjust. This is great for frames with tricky insertion depth.
review.name: A great alternative to a Fox Transfer

review.reviewBody: First off, this is a great dropper post! The tool free adjust is amazeballs for fine tuning the post travel on your bike. The air valve is actually under the seat mount and requires removing the seat and mount so I never adjusted the PSI, I set it to 300psi and its been there since new. It did start to slow down and didn't want to stop where I had it set after about 8 months of use and 3-5 rides a week , so I ordered new bushings from PNW and rebuilt it which was a breeze and now its as good as new again!
review.name: It's the little things.

review.reviewBody: Works great, easy install, drops when you push the lever and vice versa. Replaces a Specialized Command Post, which I liked but is hard to get service parts for. Note - it comes with a post-side ferrule that holds the cable lug, and then the free end goes up to the dropper, which works great for my wolf tooth lever. If you have a lug-style dropper lever, things get complicated…
review.name: Awesome post, no muss no fuss

name: Loam Dropper Seatpost

review.reviewBody:
Used this ice axe on my recent Mt. Whitney summit push. It felt super comfortable and light when using it on some spicy traverses. I did hit a couple of rocks when plunging the ax into spots, but don't see any damage done to the spike. Love that this does come with a sliding pommel to protect your hand at multiple spots along the shaft. 

I'm about 6ft and went with the 60cm length. I feel like this size worked great when you are on an inclined slope, but I did find myself wanting a longer length when on relatively flat terrain. The axe weighed in at about 15.3oz/433g without the pick, adze, and spike guard (pommel still on the axe). #BackcountryGearhead
review.name: Great and simple axe to push peaks!

review.reviewBody: This axe is not 8.5 ounces as it says in the soecs. It’s about 13 ounces. Should have checked manufacturers site before purchasing I guess.
review.name: Product description is inaccurate…

name: Bluebird Ice Axe

hasVariant.name: Expedition 2 Pro Ski Poles
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Expedition 2 Pro Ski Poles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Expedition 2 Pro Ski Poles
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Expedition 2 Pro Ski Poles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I use my poles like Xcountry skiing. I pull myself along and up steep hills for hours every day with my two husky-somethings providing excellent companionship. My complaint - one pole continues to slip and needs continuous adjustment to get back to its set height. Also, I go through the bottom part of the poles very quickly and need replacements often when the spiky part of the shaft crumbles. Alas, no replacements have been available for months meaning I have to buy a new pair!!!!! This really sucks. So a great hiking support is this, but I need replacements available to keep me going.
review.name: Favorite Poles -- ALTHOUGH collapsing lower part after 3 months only

review.reviewBody: solid, lightweight, easy to adjust the fliplock, love the strap safety mechanism. Great product
review.name: Great poles

review.reviewBody: Great poles for backcountry! Very light and easy to adjust.
review.name: Super light for backcountry

review.reviewBody: The only problem I have with them is that sometimes, because they are adjustable, they don’t stay in place and shorten when I am skiing
review.name: The only problem I have

review.reviewBody: I’ve never had any issues with these. Lots of adjustability and great foam grip.
review.name: Great poles as usual

review.reviewBody: 3 things after one season. 1) I have noticed that one of the lower sections is slightly bent; this without any major incident, I did have a couple of minor falls during the season, but nothing I can remember that would have contributed to this (I have not bent a pole in 20 years) 2) when unlocked the sections can easy be separated, there is not stop at the end. I had to back track over a run to search for a section that fell out. I was carrying another persons poles at the time, so I did not notice. Cost me an hour and I was very lucky to have found it. 3) I would have liked a larger bump out on the handle below the top grip section, when you are not using the straps your hand can slide down the pole pretty easy.
review.name: Less than what I hoped for

review.reviewBody:
I rarely write reviews but I'm writing one so maybe I can save others some trouble. This is a sweet looking pole, the FlickLock mechanism seems pretty sweet, and they're light. I received the pole with the baskets already on them. Luckily I was testing some new bindings out at home and noticed one of my baskets on the floor after using the pole to pop my boot out of the binding. I then noticed that the baskets popped off very easily as other reviews have mentioned. I'm at least glad this didn't happen on a tour and lose the basket forever.

Apparently you need to not only screw the basket on, but FIRST you need to soak them in hot water for 30+ seconds, then use an absurd and concerning amount of force (like I was worried I was going to slip and stab myself with the pole) to get the basket past the thread point and snug against a piece of plastic further up the pole. The good news is it works, the bad news.... why. Like, no other ski pole I've ever encountered required this nonsense.

Finally, I happen to have touring bindings where you can use your ski pole loop to pull upward on the binding when transitioning from ski to tour mode, but the safety feature on these just causes the loop to pop out of the handle if I try to use them that way. At least that gripe is just an imcompatibility between pole and binding features. The basket thing, however, *side eye*.
review.name: Baskets are annoying

review.reviewBody: Locking feature is super easy to use and locks tight. Baskets come off and go back on less than a minute. Overall give these a 10 out of 10.
review.name: Locking feature is super easy

review.reviewBody: Versatile & look and feel great...light weight...PERFECT!
review.name: Versatile & look and feel

review.reviewBody:
While I haven't used these yet (it is still September), they seem super nice upon receiving them. BD's flicklock tech makes adjusting them really easy, and I love the extended handle. That was actually one of the reasons I chose these poles. The handle can come out of the pole if enough force is applied, which is another cool feature. However, I'm not sure how much I would trust it in avalanche terrain. 

My only complaint is that they don't pack down very small, but since I've been using fixed-length poles up until now, it shouldn't be that big of an issue. 

Overall, they seem like a solid pair of poles. I'll have to see how they withstand to wearand tear
review.name: Seem like a solid pair of poles

name: Expedition 2 Pro Ski Poles

hasVariant.description: Buy the Deuter Freescape Pro SL 38L+ Backpack - Women's online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this as my dedicated bag for 1 day mountaineering objectives. So far I’ve used it on Mount Saint Helens and other snow hikes. The access from the back is a game changer, I can put my heavy stuff at the bottom even if I may need it immediately because I can easily get to it. The size is great so I’m able to bring everything I need plus extras. I tried Deuters 28L version and it was too small for my liking. The outside straps are good for holding crampons or snowshoes. The front pocket fits a whole shovel and probe. And the brain has lots of room for gloves, snacks, and essentials. 
It may be possible to use this as an overnight bag but it’d be tight with my current set up. 
The only downside is the back length is not adjustable and it’s a little long for my torso but I just hike it up on my hips and cinch everything down tight. I am 5’4 though so I have a smaller torso.
review.name: Perfect for 1 day mountaineering

name: Freescape Pro SL 38L+ Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: Material not what I expected. Lining inside felt plastic, and sticky.
review.name: plastic lining

review.reviewBody: I liked this for a transitional spring/fall jacket for walking to work and cycling in the pacific north west where the wind and rain are a concern, when my longer rain jacket is overkill. But I would not recommend spending the money on this jacket as the zipper on the pocket has broken within 1 year and it doesn't appear to be covered on the warranty. In fact nothing really seems covered under warranty unless never used or washed. I'll be sticking to arc teryx which has a lifetime warranty.
review.name: broken pocket zipper less than 1 year

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have twelve of this jacket, 3 shades of purple, 3 shades a pink, 1 bright yellow, 1 bright orange, royal blue, EAGLES green, white and mustard yellow. Enough said! DO NOT ever get rid of this jackets. The pit zips are one of the top things I LOVE. These are the perfect spring windbreaker/ rain jacket and can be packed into a tiny little pouch. I love the way the hood fits with a baseball hat under.
review.name: I have TWELVE! Do ya think I love them?

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great waterproof cover. I will use it to layer over my down jacket when we travel to Norway & Lapland in March. Color is perfect for me.
review.name: Love it.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the slits for the venting of the arm pits. Lightweight jacket, fits well, and keeps me very dry!
review.name: Gets the job done!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great looking and keeps me dry. I live it Georgia, so this is a perfect weight for cool, wet days! I really love my jacket!!! North Face stands behind their products, which gives me peace of mind!
review.name: I would buy this product again!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great color and arrive quickly. Rain jacket is very lightweight and has side zipper vents.
review.name: Love this lightweight jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I live in the south and we get a lot of rain and cold weather. This jacket suits my need as I don't like big, bulky items. I originally bought it for myself, but my "special needs" daughter apparently loved the color and kept eyeballing it so I gave it to her after I only wore it twice. She thinks she is something g special wearing it (she really is). It has good pockets and it's very roomy. The size fits perfectly as ordered to my normal size. You can pull the cord to make it tighter around the waist if desired so no cold air or rain will enter.
review.name: I would buy this product again and again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Can't beat The North Face for customer service! My old North Face raincoat's seams were disintegrating, and The North Face sent me an e-gift card that covered this lovely replacement raincoat. I haven't tested the coat out yet in the field this winter for real, but will certainly use it this spring and summer. Fits well and looks and feels like standard North Face quality -- it should last!
review.name: Excellent North Face customer service and products

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really love this jacket. It's not as thick as my previous north face rain coat, but the extra ventilation is great
review.name: would buy again

review.reviewBody: Perhaps this shoes fits my feet very well, but I'm not getting the blister problems everyone else is talking about. I've been running in this shoe for the last 3 weeks and had zero issues with the fit. It is a very comfortable shoe in my opinion, and the springy cushioning has been fantastic. Yesterday I did a 20 mile run and no issues. I plan on buying this shoe again once I've racked up the mileage on these which will be pretty soon.
review.name: I would buy this again

review.reviewBody: These are everything I wanted the Cielo X1 to be in a wide. Super comfortable and supportive throughout. I use my cielos on daily walks with my dog. If they came in a wide, they would be the perfect shoe. The Mach X2 was the answer, with one huge exception. They dig into the back of my heels. Blisters within a quarter mile first go. Tried again and I had to finish the walk sans shoes. Returning them, though we tried!
review.name: Nips at the heels

review.reviewBody: I like Hoka so much, I have the Cielo X2 and the Rocket X2 for my long runs, tempos and races, for my easy runs I use the Bondi 8, to change my Bondi 8 I chose the new Mach X2, I like the feeling when you run but after just 3 or 4 miles I have a bad blister on my left heel, just return it
review.name: Bad heel collar

review.reviewBody: I bought my pairs last week and after my first running session I got blisters on both heels. First time this has happened to me in more than 5 consecutive years running. Well, of course I am very disappointed and have to return the product. However, I can highlight the shoe's stability, breathability and cushioning, in that order.
review.name: Poor heel structure, blisters on the first run,

review.reviewBody: I can NOT wear this shoe without putting something on my heel because it will shred it. This is the worst heel counter in a shoe that I have ever had. I read reviews saying the heel was bad but I didn't realize it was going to be like a cheese grater on my skin. I love everything else about the shoe but it is almost unwearable because of the heel.
review.name: Amazing shoe but the heel is awful

review.reviewBody: I've been using the Mach X and the Rocket X 2 with great succes, so I was excited to try my new Mach X 2. Unfortunately these are the worst pair of running shoes I have ever tried. Blisters on both heels after a few miles of my forst run. Waste of money and it makes me want to change to another shoe brand. How can you release a shoe like this where 80% of all users are having problems with blisters.
review.name: Worst HOKA running shoe I ever owned

review.reviewBody: I thought I would try these out even with reviews- and they were right sadly. Not even a mile for me my heels were bleeding, and I would've had to limp home had I not phoned my friend. I am just so sad because I needed these shoes to work so bad. There aren't any carbon plated wide foot shoes, with the ones that do exist still being too narrow or too low in the toe box (magic speed 4, new balance v3). The mach x2's fit perfectly even for my wide feet however, but the heels for some reason were left unfinished. Who in there right mind would actually manufacture something with a self destruct button like this? I think a mass recall should be in order and the shoe should be finished before releasing. Ouch, ouch, ouch.
review.name: Painful, Bloody Heel Blisters

review.reviewBody: Love Hoka. Really have a hard time wondering how these shoes got past testing. Like so many have said, heel fit is no good. Blistered in my first mile. Sent them back. Wait for improvements in this model, or just skip altogether...as maybe this model should never have been.
review.name: Need to rethink

review.reviewBody: Blisters the size of quarters on the heels of both feet just like many are reporting. Two runs and I am forced to return/exchange them. Gonna have to utilize my Carbon X2's a while longer.
review.name: Wanted to love them but ouch!

review.reviewBody: This is my 4th Hoka shoe. I used Carbon X3, Challenger ATR 7GTX and my favorite Cielo X1. I bought the Mach X2 as it is a cross between Cielo X1 and the Mach series. I feel that the shoe is lighter than Cielo X1, feels great, not as bouncy as Cielo X1 but for me it's perfect. The one thing that Needs improvement is the heel collar. That part has been fighting back and after an 11mile run I ended up with bloody heels. I also feel that the upper could have been at least 10mm taller in the ankle / heel area. Having previously used the Cielo X1 (1,350K), on the Mach X2 the heel counter is a swing and a miss. It just doesn't function well. I had heel lift in the shoe, but when you were running it didn't bother me (maybe because the rubbing distracted me more), but it was noticeable. Using a runner's loop won't help much either.
review.name: I would buy this model again but I'd love some changes

name: Mach X 2 Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great for those cool mornings or nights where you don't need something so heavy but a long sleeve t-shirt is not enough to keep you comfortable.

review.reviewBody: From day one, it's been one of my favorite flannel shirts! The fabric is soft and warm, and the fit is just right, making it the perfect go-to for any casual outing. I can't help but feel cozy every time I wear it!

review.reviewBody: I have purchased several of North Face's flannel-style button shirts, and I have to say this Arroyo Flannel is definitely my favorite of the bunch. Decided to buy in different colors. Might try the "lightweight" version next!

hasVariant.name: Reflective Utility Cord Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Reflective Utility Cord Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have used this cord kit to secure a rain tarp, set up a laundry line, as well as hang lights and other gear. At ~50ft it has been more than long enough to reach the two closest trees anyplace I have camped. The tensioners are simple enough to use.
review.name: Great Cord Kit

review.reviewBody:
If you're a fan of MSR gear, picking up some of this extra rope is a nice add to your kit or to prepare before getting into the field. 

The rope is thicker than the guylines that come with some MSR tents, making it more versatile for different applications. Overall, happy with the purchase.
review.name: Tons of extra rope

review.reviewBody: Used this this as an additional guy line and it is perfect!
review.name: As advertised and no quality drop.

review.reviewBody: Love the way the line lights up with headlamps - cutting out late night trip hazards. When my bootlace snapped on the trail, I turned to the utility cord. My only qualm was that my eyelets on my Asolo boots were just small enough to make running this line through a pain. I finally got it through but perhaps a couple MM skinnier would have been a breeze. Otherwise, great stuff to bring along for any outdoor endeavor.
review.name: Love the reflectivity - a tad skinnier would be ideal

review.reviewBody: I use this cord to hang a food bag when on multi-day hikes. It's good because it's easy to find in the dark with a flashlight. It'd be better without the little ring things, I'm a knot guy so...it'd be nice to have the option of simply buying the cord.
review.name: Learn to tie knots :)

review.reviewBody: Not much can go wrong with something this lightweight and strong. The camlock rings are a nice touch and functional too.
review.name: Strong and lightweight.

review.reviewBody: This line is perfect for hanging up wetsuits to dry around camp - simple setup, easy to adjust length and tension, and plenty of strength for all of our wet items. If properly hung betweens close branches on nearby trees, or other supports it can support wet suits for drying between sessions. Also ideal for stringing LED lights or mini lanterns at camp for better lighting. Mine only came with 3 tension rings, rather than the 4 in the images. Great utility cord to keep in your camping kit.
review.name: A well hung line

review.reviewBody: This is exceptional cordage; I would like to address the pro's and con's of it however. I did, as stated, buy the cordage for cutting my own tarp guy lines but ended up using it as a bear hanging kit with my own carbiner. I do NOT use the PCT method to hang as I think it could lead to an animal running through and grabbing the line and ending up with a handy snack. What any decent outdoorsman will tell you is you do need at least 40-50 feet of hang line to make room for mistakes etc. When I hang I simply roll so that if my line does get 'stuck' this cordage makes a simple job of unrolling and slipping back over the limb, throw again-get it right and do a simple hitch knot high enough and you're done. No bags full of rocks or other trees to tie against, any of that hooplahh. The one issue with this cordage I became frustrated with was the kinking in the line. It can become tedious to undue, especially when you are trying to throw your line for the fifth time. If you don't remove these kinks it can easily trip the cord up and you must never cut your rope...I couldn't believe how many grown men I watched cut their lines due to the PCT method and bad knots. Simple tension is all you need. My rope is still in good shape with no thread issues and still has all 49 feet attached due to its glide and proper hanging.
review.name: Bought initially for tarp-used for bear bag instead..

review.reviewBody: I own a tent that, while freestanding, benefits from having some extra guy lines attached to it. While I know how to tie a variety of camping related knots, if I'm tired, cold, hungry, and racing to set up camp before weather rolls in, this kit lets me secure my tent much more quickly. I've used these as independent guy lines, as well as to extend existing guy lines when I want to wrap around a tree that's a bit out of reach. One caveat: you're going to have to re-tie the knot used on the ring as it is too small and will slip out of the hole the cord passes through. Once you fix that, the ring does a great job at adding enough friction to keep the cord at a set length, a replacement for the often cursed trucker's hitch.
review.name: Fast and efficient, lightweight too

review.reviewBody: I used to use the old boy scout taut line hitch to adjust the length of my tent lines. Now with these sliding rings and super-strong super-light line adjusting the tautness of the tent is a snap. They hold well and never slide when you don't want them to. The only issue for me was to remember which hole in the ring does what. Once done, it was easy to replicate. I use these for hanging my food, setting up my tent, stringing a line. Anywhere that I need to adjust the length.
review.name: So Much Easier Than Knots!

name: Reflective Utility Cord Kit

review.reviewBody: I ordered a small originally before reading the reviews. I also needed to size down with xs. They are comfortable yet too long, I have to unzip the side and fold up.
review.name: Need to offer petite size

review.reviewBody: I wore these out and about the other day with the matching long jacket and I received non-stop compliments. No one had seen the pants before. Meanwhile, I was toasty warm from top to bottom. I just wore them as a base layer skiing and stayed incredibly comfortable all day. I love these pants! They run a little big, but the roominess is nice, especially for being active.
review.name: So warm and stylish!

review.reviewBody: I love these pants and want another pair ASAP. I live in Maine and plan on wearing these hiking. I took a walk down my street in 25 degree weather as a test and was perfectly warm. Can't wait to get them on the mountain!
review.name: Great hiking pants

review.reviewBody: I just moved to COLORADO. I love it here but I’m freezing. The wind can really blow here in the winter!!! These pants have saved my life and giving me comfort and warmth in the great outdoors. These pants are so warm, tough, and cute. I get compliments on these every time I wear them! ❤️ I love them.
review.name: Down pants!!

review.reviewBody: The pants fit very comfortably. They are very light weight but warmest pant I now own. Worn them once around town and received lots of compliments. The retro look is also cool!
review.name: Fuego pants are amazing!

review.reviewBody: Not too bulky. The colors are great. Warm on its own but still enough room for thermals if it gets really cold. True to size. I’m excited to play in these
review.name: Fits right and feels good

review.reviewBody: I just received my down pants and couldn't be more thrilled! Wore them day one for a late fall cabin camp out in the Alaskan mountains and they did NOT disappoint!
review.name: Cozy and light

review.reviewBody: I ordered these pants last year in a medium and they were HUGE. These pants are so great they were sold out in smalls everywhere. I've been waiting a year for them to come back out and now I have them! Sooooo excited to have these for winter.
review.name: Happy pants!

review.reviewBody:
I'd give it 10 stars if I could!!!
The model sizing was spot on!
My girlfriend gets cold, very cold. Once she is cold it is hard to warm back up. This creates an issue when you want to be outside adventuring.
These pants are the best! Should've got them a long time ago..
She absolutely LOVES them.
First adventure, whales on the beach at Shi Shi.
Second adventure, bears on Vancouver Island.
Third adventure, goats in Alpine Lakes.
Not to say these pants will bring this, but they might!

Please take care of the land we love when you are out there, don't bring your Bluetooth speaker please.
review.name: BEST THING EVER

review.reviewBody: I love these pants so much! They are so fun and super duper lightweight. The colors are amazing and the 70’s retro vibe makes me smile! The only issue is that these are HUGE! I normally wear a large, but accidentally ordered a small and it fits perfectly. Definitely size down if you don’t what to wear many, many layers underneath. It’s snowing today and I’m looking forward to frolicking in the snow in my fuego pants!
review.name: These pants are pure joy!

name: Fuego Down Pant - Women's
