review.reviewBody: Partner couldn’t wear as too narrow.  Dissapointed
review.name: Merrelll

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing a pair of Hydroslide 2s daily for the last 6 weeks in Hawaii. I am very impressed by their comfort and support. The deep heel cup prevents your foot from sliding sideways out the side (a big problem I have with most slides and flipflops), and I have no issue  driving in them. They also are wearing much better tha I had hoped. They do run large, but order down and you'll be just fine.  The also clean up just fine in the sink, or just wear them in the pool. My only change would be a couple more holes across the top for better ventilation.
review.name: Unexpectedly Great

review.reviewBody:
I was about to give these a full 5 Stars when an odd thing happened. After wearing them daily in Hawaii for about 10 days, I pulled them off to find my instep covered with tiny red blisters - prickly heat. Looking at them, I realized the instep is almost completely solid, so 
I shouldn't be too surprised in a hot and humid tropical environment. That aside, the Hydro Slide 2 has proven to be supremely comfortable and supportive. I cannot wear flip-flops - for whatever reason I end up with my heel uncomfortably half off the footbed. These have a very definite heel pocket, and I don't hesitate to drive in them. They stay put on my foot. I'll probably try drilling some vent holes across the instep to improve the prickly heat issue. I truly hope Merrell doesn't kill this product, but evolves it. It deserves a chance to become another Merrell classic like the Jungle Moc and Moab hiking boot. Caveat noted, I highly recommended this shoe.
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: The Hydro Slide 2 is an extremely comfortable and durable slide that fits true to size with a narrow fit to them. Along with a very slick style to them. I recommend this item.
review.name: “Merrell Is A Staple”

review.reviewBody: They run big. My normal 9 was too big. The 8 was perfect. Looks like they may last forever. Durable.
review.name: GREAT SHOES

review.reviewBody: Never knew why people love these over sized thongs till I tried them on. Love them.
review.name: Hydro Moc Slide

review.reviewBody: There tight on my feet, hope they stretch a little if I give them a chance, really wanted the old style merrel slides that you guessed it , now not available!
review.name: Old merrell slides! Why delete a good product!!

review.reviewBody: I love them but I'm sorry I didn't get one size bigger, the outlet store didn't have the larger size so I took the smaller size because the sales assistant said they'd stretch a little as they age. The problem is they're a bit tight & I don't wear them much.
review.name: Size Matters

review.reviewBody: Was very happy wearing them a couple hours a day for the first few weeks.  But then wore them for about 8 hours while travelling and got a couple of blisters, so rating went down to 3-Stars.
review.name: Comfortable in Short Doses

review.reviewBody: I bought this about 3 months ago. They have performed as I had hoped they would. I would buy again because they are comfortable.

name: Hydro Slide 2 Sandal - Men's

description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Dynama/2 Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dynama/2 Pant - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Dynama/2 Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Pros: great fit and stylish   Cons: WAY too long for average female.  Had to return unfortunately.  Wish you offered a ‘short’ length in addition to the ‘ankle’ length which I have 3 pair of.
review.name: Pros & Cons

review.reviewBody: The most comfortable pant I own, especially for travel.  The lack of a zipper and button closure make them so easy to pull up and down and comfortable to sit in.  I’m 4’10” and 138lbd and wear a small that I had shortened.
review.name: My favorite pants

review.reviewBody: A little in the rise. Very light weight, great for summer hiking.
review.name: Great summer hiking pant.

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing the old version, Style 1642081, and loved them.  Recently went to purchase more and discovered you changed the style.  I absolutely dislike the new cheaper pull cord at the bottom.  The original version used a grossgrain ribbon and it was really attractive when gathered.  The new version has a rubber cord much like they use now in trail running shoes.  Cheap and ugly! So disappointed.  They were my go to pants!
review.name: Dislike the current version of original Dynamo pant. Drawstring at hem is ugly and pants gather differently.

review.reviewBody: Best hiking pants ever. My only complaint is that there isn't a fleece-lined version. :-)
review.name: Perfect Pants

review.reviewBody: Love these pants! So comfortable, fits perfectly over the top of my hiking boots. Quick drying. My favorite part is that they are pull-on (no zipper or button) which makes a quick pee in the woods so much easier! :-)
review.name: My favorite hiking pant - I have every colour!

review.reviewBody: I have an older pair of these pants which fit great.  For some reason, the new pair I just ordered fits differently in the waistband. There seems to be less stretch making the pants harder to pull over the hips.  Otherwise, these pants are an excellent silhouette, comfortable and perfect for hiking and other athletic pursuits which require freedom of movement.
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: These are very comfortable pants. Great for lounging or hiking!
review.name: Wonderful pants

review.reviewBody:
Love these!  The Dynama 2 pants (both full length and ankle length) are my favorite pants ever.  I have both styles in several colors and wear them year round including to work and really love them for travel. They don’t scream “hiking pants.”  The zipper pocket on the left thigh is really handy but also subtle so it doesn’t look like cargo pants. The fabric is super soft, stretchy, and has held up great.  Some of the ones I have are a few years old at this point and get worn like almost once a week and have no pilling or fading or other signs of wear.  I don’t put them in the dryer - they hang dry super fast.    I’m 5’5” and weigh 110 and wear XS.  Love the stretch waistband and not having to fool with a zipper and button.  

Please keep making them!  And adding fun colors is always a good thing :)
review.name: Awesome hiking or anytime pants

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, lightweight, good pockets. I’m 5’7” 128 lbs. and small fits perfectly.
review.name: All I Was Looking For

name: Dynama/2 Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: Used on last couple long hikes in the Utah Capitol Reef Park. Works as expected. Quality product. Great enhancement to the Big Zip Evo 3L water bladder.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: What a joy to finally have a bite valve cover that fits a Platypus and does exactly what it is supposed to do - keep the dirt out. It is easy to install, and to pop off and on for sips. It was reasonably priced and arrived quickly.
review.name: Dirt No More

review.reviewBody: The bite cover works perfectly. However, what I really like is the cut-off valve, which has prevented a lot of water spills when taking my backpack off and/or laying it down. Super upgrade with both.
review.name: The bite cover works perfectly.

review.reviewBody: Honnêtement très content de ma poche à eau platypus ! Mais je ne comprends pas pourquoi vous vendez le bouchon séparément, en effet dès que l'on part en randonnée et que l'on pose son sac au sol, l'embout de la poche a eau se salit ! Le bouchon est donc indispensable, alors pour le vendre séparément ?
review.name: Pourquoi ce bouchon n'est pas inclus avec la poche à eau ?!

review.reviewBody: Good cover but I bought the wrong cover for the valve I have so it doesn't really fit
review.name: Good cover but I bought

review.reviewBody: This bite cover is great! It seals super tight. So tight in fact that occasionally when I open it, I pull the bite valve off and shoot water everywhere!
review.name: Super tight fitting cover

review.reviewBody: I love it! I used to get dirt in my mouthpiece when I would set my pack down. This has solved the problem.
review.name: No more gritty water

review.reviewBody: I wish there was a cover for the low flow bite valve. This cover keeps the high flow bite valve clean. I feel more comfortable setting my pack down now.
review.name: Bite valve stays clean

review.reviewBody: This keeps my bite valve covered so I don't have to worry about where i set down my pack. Seems durable. East to use. Have one for each of my bladders.
review.name: Wouldn't use a bladder without it

review.reviewBody: Works great. Not difficult to install. Exactly what I needed to keep the bite valve off my sweaty body.
review.name: Works great. Keeps bite valve off sweaty body.

name: Bite Valve Cover

review.itemreviewed: HMS Bruce Steel Triple FG Locking Carabiner
review.reviewBody: If you're rappelling in the southwest canyons (such as Zion National Park), you know how abrasive sandstone can be on your gear.  The carabiner attached to your belay/descending device takes a beating.  A steel carabiner will outlast an aluminum carabiner by a long shot.  I keep it permanently attached to my Sterling ATS.  The alternative would be the aluminum Edelrid HMS Bulletproof Triple FG carabiner with the stainless steel insert, which I also own.  I keep this carabiner permanently attached to my CRITR2.  Yes, the steel version is heavier than an aluminum one, but the longevity is what I purchased it for.  If you want your carabiner to last as long as possible in abrasive environments, I think a steel frame is worth the weight.
review.name: HMS Steel Triple FG Locking Carabiner

name: HMS Bruce Steel Triple FG Locking Carabiner

hasVariant.name: XG-1299 XX1 Eagle 12-Speed Cassette
hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM XG-1299 XX1 Eagle 12-Speed Cassette online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I had installed the XX1 cassette previously on my 2021 bike (road/gravel) and was very pleased with it. I went ahead and installed another XX1 cassette on my 2023 road bike.
A significant reduction in total cassette weight. Combined with the XX1 chain on both bikes, the shifting with a conventional SRAM derailleur set-up is smooth and without issues. I can recommend the XX1 Cassette without any reservations.
review.name: A worthy upgrade

review.reviewBody: I have noticed a significant difference on the extreme uphills with the extra 2 teeth compared to a 10-50t cog. The gold color looks awesome and I am enjoying the full new SRAM drivetrain as compared to the cheaper NX I had on my bike from the factory.
review.name: Huge improvement

review.reviewBody: I bought this cassette and it was defective.  The threads were bent so when I attempted to install the cassette it was crooked.  Boxed everything up and sent back to Backcountry.
review.name: The SRAM Factory In China Is Not Back

review.reviewBody:
As of this review, the new SRAM 52T is still fairly new and making it's way out to the masses.  I recently upgraded to the AXS drivetrain and felt that it would be appropriate to bring on the new 52T cassette.  I purchased it from my LBS on 8/12/2020 and was STOKED  because I had some big climbs (3-4k) on the schedule for August into September.  As expected, everything was flawless and worked with precision and the crispness you'd expect. 

9/18/2020 - I was doing routine maintenance on the bike and while lubing the chain, I noticed one of the Tooth on the 52t cog was chipped.  No more than 40 hours on the cassette, I was in complete shock.  I like to think that I ride "hard" but it's a brand new cassette.  

I've got a warranty submission via LBS, I trust that SRAM will take care of me. I'll keep you guy posted.
review.name: 52T, 52 Weeks?

name: XG-1299 XX1 Eagle 12-Speed Cassette

description: Buy the Big Agnes Copper Spur HV UL1 Tent: 1-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Copper Spur HV UL1 Tent: 1-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Big Agnes Copper Spur HV UL1 Tent: 1-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Replaced my 10 year old Copper Spur UL-1, 2500+ mile model with the new model and took it on a 200 mile shakedown AT hike in Maryland-Pennsylvania. New fabric dries out well and new door design is  an improvement (no more sitting on the netting/door).  Added Velcro tabs for tarp-to-pole connections gives stability for the new feature that allows the vestibule to become an awning. The "3D" net storage bin in foot area was GREAT to dry out socks (doesn't solve the sock odor issue, but hey Big Agnes can't solve that inherent fact of long distance hiking....)
review.name: AT Section Hiker

review.reviewBody: Lighter than my older version of this tent - which served me well over 8 years and hundreds of miles.  I like the improved door zipper location - keeping the doors off the floor.  What I don't like is the new fly / tent / peg plastic clip setup - it is a really poor design.  One of the clips failed where it connects to the webbing loop on the 3rd night.  It just appears it was overstressed, supporting the fly, the tension from the poles, and the tent pegs.  It would be so much more reliable if there was a grommet in the webbing loop to hold the tent poles, if the tent  peg loops had also been tied directly to the webbing, and the plastic clip had been used to only attach the fly to the body of the tent.   Hope they fix this in future releases - it really shouldn't be failing on the second use / third night.  I had my previous version for 8 years without a single problem.  I wouldn't recommend this tent until the clip issue is corrected.
review.name: Second version of this tent I've owned

review.reviewBody: I haved used the tent for about 15 nights on three separate backpacking trip in the intermountain west.  I am a fairly long human at 6'-5". It has rained.  It has snowed.  The wind has blown.  It has performed well in every respect.  I have always been comfortable.  It is crazy light.  There are no rips but - the fabric feels very thin so I have been extremely careful.
review.name: Great Tent

review.reviewBody: The Copper Spur HV UL series is the ultimate ultralight home away from home.
review.name: Copper Spur HV UL series

review.reviewBody:
Got delivered today, quick set-up maybe 2 minutes , no instructions needed..

Super light weight for my standards and small pack size wow..

This tent will be great for just me, little gear holder inside and some pockets plus the vestibule , more then enough space went with the olive green figure it would blend in off trail better..

As long as this tent keeps me dry it will be a amazing little tent..(Will Update)
review.name: Copper Spur HV UL1

review.reviewBody: Fits great but very thin material.  Prefer the Baker Bib
review.name: Great fit but super light weight

review.reviewBody: Taken out only one day so far, but very happy with the build and features. Plenty of zips/ventilation and pockets. Material is light and airy. Im shorter and a bit stocky in the torso with a 30 in inseam and a 32 waist, and mediums are perfect. A touch tight on the torso, and a touch long in street shoes, but with my build and my short inseam I expect it. Still very comfy. I returned the large because they were huge. I Do NOT recommend sizing down as others had suggested.
review.name: Baggy fit, true to size, nice features,

review.reviewBody: Fantastic bib, I put it through the wringer this year as I learned how to ski.   The bib is impervious to moisture on ski lifts and durable enough to survive a multitude of 60+ mph falls onto icy piste without any tears.  I went with the advice of other reviewers and bought a size up and I’d agree that it was the right choice.
review.name: Durable and Waterproof

review.reviewBody: I own both the Baker and Smythe bib. While the baker is a beefier and heavier bib, I prefer the Smythe bib for anything besides a cold resort day where the Bakers seem better suited. Smythe is a more breathable and thinner layer. Holding these two bibs in each hand, the Smythe is noticeably more lightweight. Great for skinning with a beacon pocket on the chest. I never get hot in these and they feel great with a good range of motion. I’m not entirely sure on the durability as I’ve only tested them out on 5 skins. As others have said, I would size up. I’m 5’9” 190 lbs with larger thighs and upper body. The large fits me perfect. The Baker is a solid bib for backcountry too but if you run hot and looking to shave ounces, then this is your bib.
review.name: Excellent backcountry bib

review.reviewBody: I just got back from my first AK heli trip and these bibs performed really well!  Hopping in and out of the shuttle to/from the lodge plus climbing in and out the heli, they held up to everything.  The only thing missing on these bibs are inner thigh vents.  I'm 5'7" / 180# and the large fits quite comfortably.  Hoping to get 10 years out of these like I did with my last pair of Flylows.
review.name: Great, Stylish Bibs

review.reviewBody: As much as I love the freeride style of skiing, I?m still a ?I don?t want my ski kit to be too baggy? kinda guy. I suppose that comes from my years of ski mountaineering and alpine ice climbing where I climb best in trimmer clothes. So, I wanted a bib that would be that, be light and breathable enough for touring and climbing, yet burly enough for getting after it on the descents. And looks stylish doing it?especially if doing inbounds days at the resort. This is that bib! Granted, wanting all that comes with the risk of being potentially easier to tear. I?ve been a diehard Patagonia, BD, and Arcturus fan for 20 years. So, this is my first Flylow purchase and I?m totally sold. They fit perfect for me. But 37 days I them last season and they still look like new. Stoked I got them.
review.name: Amazing bibs

review.reviewBody: Like most ski pants, these are too baggy. Haven?t found a high quality pair of ski/board pants that long enough with out being enormous.
review.name: Too wide and baggy

review.reviewBody: Our lightest air permeable bib meant for touring.
review.name: 2020 Smythe Bib video

name: Smythe Bib Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Benton Springs II Long Hooded Fleece Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Benton fleece hoddie jackets have been a staple in our family’s wardrobe for years. I have bought them for my Mom, Daughter, Aunt, Sister In Law and myself. We each have the shorter version with no hood, the shorter version with hood and now this year I am gifting this style (longer with hood). They are perfect for Spring and Fall. I also have layered the hood one under my heavy jacket for extra cold outdoor adventures. Great quality we highly recommend these jackets. We are huge Columbia fans! We do size up, since we like more room for layering.
review.name: Love this jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Benton Springs II Long Hooded Fleece Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was in need of a new fleece after many many years with my last Columbia fleece.  This one is thicker with a wonderful high neck to keep the wind at bay, and the long length is terrific.  I love the grey color. It goes with everything. This fleece is going to be my favorite cozy jacket for, I’m sure, as many years as I wore my last.  It’s terrific !
review.name: Wonderfully cozy hooded long fleece

review.reviewBody: As advertised. Sizing is appropriate (size 12). Good casual shoe
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: Love the barefoot feel! Almost like walkinh on nothing! Great grip, even on slippery surfaces - I'm not even a boater! I wear them hiking in the desert. They're perfect for creek shoes! Yes, we have creeks and rivers in AZ!
review.name: Perfect for Water Hiking

review.reviewBody: I like these shoes. This is my second pair, and I went for the green. They're simple, sort of zero-drop shoes, but comfy and practical.
review.name: Enjoying pair #2

review.reviewBody: This is an incredible travel shoe. Lightweight, compact, easy to pack - awesome. I even put an orthotic in them if I’m just walking around town. As a water shoe also great, BUT they are not good in any environment with sand. The material of the tongue collects sand and the heal cup, which is nice and padded (great for comfort!) BUT the heel material is not fully stitched to the heel cup, so sand gets heavy deposited in this space. It’s impossible to rinse out and I’m left with crunchy sand embedded behind my heel, which is not comfortable to say the least. It’s so bad, I’m wondering if that non-stitching is a manufacturing defect.
review.name: Good, but flawed as a water shoe.

review.reviewBody: Super comfy, stylish and great in the water…dunno what else anyone would want.
review.name: Yaaaaa

review.reviewBody: Love these shoes, wear my first pair all the time. Easy to slip on and off. Lightweight, but still good support. This is my second pair, holding them in reserve.
review.name: Love the Loyaks

review.reviewBody: Just a great shoe. Comfortable and looks good. Price is right too.
review.name: All around good shoe

review.reviewBody: They accumulate and hold sand inside the shoe, whereas I had understood they would not
review.name: bob

review.reviewBody: Finally got a chance to take this out on my SUP: clean up of a local run with group of college students. The sticky soles are great. The shoes are super comfortable, and the look great, too. Hoping to get lots of paddling trips with these.
review.name: Loyaks are my go to for SUP

review.reviewBody: Loyak M’s solid choice for River SUP. I was recently on the Glover River in SE Oklahoma and the water levels were low. I had to hike on the slippery rocks in the river pulling my inflatable sup. They performed great -light weight -look cool.
review.name: Loyak Shoes hanging tough in Gnarly SUP adventures

name: Loyak Water Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Summer in south Florida has mega sun.  There's really no option as to whether or not to protect your skin. The question is how.  Lotion works.  Sun sleeves work better. These sleeves do the job.  Lightweight.  Easy to put on.  The only negative is that they are a little too warm.  That said, I'm in super hot/humid weather and my "complaint" may be bit misplaced.
review.name: They Do the Trick

review.reviewBody:
Love them so much, bought one in black and one in white.
Got ride of two old sets of sleeves, that I finally got fed up using, because the sleeves would never stay up properly.  I guess I kind of have normal to small arms.  Size medium sleeve, if that makes a difference.  Anyway the "grips" at the top of these sleeves are super tight. As it should be.
review.name: If you have big guns, ignore this review

review.reviewBody: I am happy with this product excellent quality
review.name: Excelent  Product

review.reviewBody: My husband loves these, uses them for running, golf, cycling and everything in between! Perfect for changing weather as an extra layer or for long hours in the sun.
review.name: Bought a third pair, multi use

review.reviewBody: I have had sun sleeves for a few years and the Castelli brand stay up more then some other brands. I have had bouts with squamous cell carcinoma and in Arizona we need all the UV protection we can get.
review.name: Sun protection

review.reviewBody: I used the arm sleeves for the first time today on a very sunny 95 degree day. I don't think my arms were any hotter than they would have been without the sleeves.  It was a 6 hr ride so it was very convenient not having to re-apply sunscreen. The arm sleeves stayed up well. The material is quite lightweight, which is what I want, so I'm careful taking them on and off.  I can see them stretching or ripping if they're pulled a lot. I initially bought medium size but they were too small.  Large fits much better - form fitting but not constrictive.  My forearms are 10 3/4" around.  With my arm bent at a 90 degree angle but relaxed muscles, my biceps are 12" around.
review.name: Great sun protection

review.reviewBody: Have been using these instead of sunblock on longer rides in SoCal that start around 60dF and end around 80, along with the knee sleeves.  It takes the chill of the early start and I don't notice them other than when I get the occasional cooling effect in a breeze once the air has warmed up.   This was especially noticeable on a recent ride with a long climb in the sun and about 80 degrees where I would get that momentary cooling effect.  I am a fan of these for longer rides that start early and transition into the heat.   I bought XL in the arm sleeves and L in the knee sleeves, as I don't have pencil arms but the stretch is good and I think the L would work good for a more compressive fit on the arms.
review.name: Start off chilly and ride into the heat.

review.reviewBody: stays in place, fits well, provides enough warmth, and protects the skin from the sun. it's perfect for those slightly chilly rides or when you're in between sun and cover. i would even consider wearing on a warm day to use for sun protection.
review.name: does its job

name: UPF 50+ Light Arm Sleeves

hasVariant.description: Buy the Old Town Sportsman 120 Pedal Kayak online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I really love this kayak. It is hard to beat. BUT ... I really wish that they would add rear tracks and a handle to the back. I know that I can add them, but for the money they should be factory installed. It is pretty heavy.
review.name: I love it but ...

review.reviewBody: This is my first venture with kayak fishing.  The kayak is comfortable and stable.  It maneuvers well.  Maiden voyage I caught 5 spotted trout, so I'd say off to a good start.  Still way low on the learning curve but I am very pleased with the purchase.
review.name: Off to a great start

review.reviewBody: The best kayak I have ever owned. I started out with an Ascend FS12T, winds and waves were an issue, not anymore. The OT PDL120 is stable and quick, I am 240lbs and 5"11 male. The kayak is great and confidence on big lakes is super important for obvious safety reasons. I have had water over the bow many times and crashed through 2 foot boat wakes with ease. Thank you Old Town. I will buy another one in the future.
review.name: Old Town PDL 120

review.reviewBody: I bought this beauty in spring of 2022 and we fell in love with it
review.name: I love my PDL120

review.reviewBody: Old Town Kayaks are addictive. I started out with a Topwater 120. Then I bought my wife an Old Town Sportsman 106 PDL because she had a hard time keeping up with me as I paddled. I then had to buy myself a Sportsman 120 PDL to keep up with her. These kayaks see a lot of use from long trips around our mountain lakes we live near to hauling them to the Gulf every year for vacation. I am 6’4 and 220 lbs. and this kayak is stable for enough for me to standup and fish on. No problem with rough waters in the ocean. I have had breakers lapping over the top of the bow and the kayak never loses a step. These are the only kayaks my wife will set foot on. My next step is to add a motor to my original Old Town 120.
review.name: Great kayaks

review.reviewBody: This was one of my favorite purchases I think I've ever made.  This yak is stable as can be and moves at a really nice cruising speed and a good top end when I feel like going for broke on my legs.  It's a little heavy, but I knew that going in to the purchase and I'm fine with that.  It car-tops really well with a t-bar on a crossover vehicle.  It's really easy to steer and by being as heavy as it is, it holds well along the grassline of the marsh when you want to hold your position to fish.  Reverse drive and the simple mechanism to pop up the pedals in shallow water makes this perfect fishing platform for tidal waters and creeks.  You won't be sorry.
review.name: All I expected +

review.reviewBody: I bought this kayak last year and couldn't be happier. I took it out on a small lake and fished for about 10 hours straight (caught a nice mess of bluegill). I expected my back to get sore, but the seat is so comfortable that I had no issue. I think pedalling is also helpul, as it keeps the blood moving. I can't wait to take it out again this spring. There is plenty of storage space and this kayak is very stable and sturdy; I'm 6'4", 260lbs, had a full cooler and plenty of gear, and had no issue whatsoever. I'm very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Great Design

review.reviewBody: I bought this kayak last year and couldn't be happier. I took it out on a small lake and fished for about 10 hours straight (caught a nice mess of bluegill). I expected my back to get sore, but the seat is so comfortable that I had no issue. I think pedalling is also helpul, as it keeps the blood moving. I can't wait to take it out again this spring. There is plenty of storage space and this kayak is very stable and sturdy; I'm 6'4", 260lbs, had a full cooler and plenty of gear, and had no issue whatsoever. I'm very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Great Design

name: Sportsman 120 Pedal Kayak

review.reviewBody: Ultra light wind shell. Doesn't feel to clammy even after sweating heavily in it. Feels a little fragile, so be careful when slipping it over your head to not tear it. Fabric is not stretchy.
review.name: Ultra light

review.reviewBody: Just used this with great success on a recent thru-hike of the Colorado Trail. Helped keep me warm on those chilly mornings and deflected wind on blustery exposed ridge walks. It’s incredibly ultralight and packs down very small
review.name: Excellent wind protection

review.reviewBody: Ultra light for ultra running make a lot of sense!!!
review.name: Ultra light!

review.reviewBody: this wind shell is super light weight but is a perfect layering item for cool or misty mornings-- this plus a light weight fleece or wool under layer are ideal for the trails or whatever your adventure.
review.name: Favorite layer

review.reviewBody: great layer for that one day when you are slower then you thought and,,,,,,,,,!
review.name: great layer for that one

review.reviewBody: I bought it for cycling so that I can store it in my seat bag or stem bag because it is so light and compact. Then, if things get a little chilly on my ride I can pull it out and put it on quickly. For such a light and thin material it is surprisingly strong and windproof. The only thing I don't like is that it flaps in the wind and makes noise.
review.name: Better than I expected

review.reviewBody: 4 stars because it would have maybe added half an ounce to finish the zipper... But for what this thing is meant to do (which is not a rain shell like the other review suggests) it's great. An emergency layer for when it's not too cold and quite windy. I use thing thing mostly from April to September when I don't think there will be rain. It's better on the back than a full rain jacket. If it's cold or if I think it might rain at all where I'm hiking, running, climbing or riding, then I'll take my fineline stretch (also by BD which I highly recommend). Ultimately this thing fits great, performs well as a windbreaker, and performs even better when sitting in your pack as you'll definitely not be able to notice it in there. The only reason I wouldn't recommend it ever is if you're not already set on rain shells. This is definitely a luxury item that comes after you've got a rain shell, since any rain jacket will do what this can and more.
review.name: Great for what it is

review.reviewBody: This is a well designed jacket which performs well as a rain shell. I used it mountain biking in Utah during a slight shower, but the breathability was limited. I was pretty clammy at the end.
review.name: Good wind shell, not for MTB

review.reviewBody: perfect wind shell / extra warm layer. I use mine trail running mostly, and its so small and light you forget you even packed it. Worth every penny.
review.name: light and protective

review.reviewBody: It’s shoulder season here in the New River Gorge and this is the perfect addition for a bike or run. If the morning starts out cool and drizzly, I put it on and easily take it off and pack it in my pocket while still running.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A few years ago I bought the Brett low top sneaker and it fits great. I wanted to get an updated nicer looking version so I tried these out. Unfortunately they are very narrow across the toes and are not close to fitting, even with very thin socks. The style is great and they seem well made but they don’t fit my feet
review.name: Narrow feet only

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm replacing a pair of 6-yr-old Low Lace Walkers. The quality of leather lining was better, the eyelets had grommets, the fit and comfort were better. And they were made in the USA, so presumably more expensive to produce. I'll wear these Astors, but they surely don't have the feel of other Frye products that I've owned (still have a pair of boots that are probably 40 years old).
review.name: Previous shoes were better

review.reviewBody: These tires came on my new bike. The front tire was perfect, the back had some issues staying full even with no rides on it yet. It was a slight headache having to get that full so I could ride the bike but Back Country helped me out throughout the process. With 3 failed attempts at keeping air in the tires, with the help of the local bike shop who helped reseal, retape, and examine, Back Country sent out a new tire free of charge and it has been holding great. I think the initial tire must have been an outlier on these tires since the local bike mechanics said WTB tires are usually perfect quality. But I got past that issue and now I am able to ride around without worry and Back Country came through by providing a replacement tire.
review.name: Should hold up great

review.reviewBody: I have about 1k miles on these (700x40) so far in everything from road riding to super chunky gravel events like Keystone Gravel in PA to smooth and fast gravel in Kansas and Iowa. I run them at 38lbs and I'm ~175lbs. I think I still prefer the Riddlers to these, but I'll definitely run these until they wear out. No problems w/ puncturing any area of the tire. They mount up easily and hold air w/o concern, using Stans fluid. Oh and I'm on the original version, not the new SG2.
review.name: Pretty good tire.

name: Venture TCS Tubeless Tire

review.reviewBody:
This visor fails on multiple levels. One, as a runner, it’s simply way too HEAVY. The weight of it rides down on my ears when I’m running. If I tighten it, it feels too tight and constricts blood flow. There’s not really a way to make it comfortable. I don’t need heavy nylon webbing in a visor. 

Two, sweat will stain this visor after your first run. I’ve washed this visor and it didn’t help. You’ll have an ugly discolored sweat stain on the light colored brim, and obvious rings of salt on the black upper. 

There, given the above, the price point is unreasonable. Trust me, just find something lighter weight and cheaper that won’t stain after your first sweat.
review.name: Not runner friendly

name: Organic Strapvisor
